title: Celtics to trade Porzingis to Hawks, sources say

title: Dacoits rob trader in fake gold deal, then get robbed by another gang in Hyderabad, 18 arrested

title: Explained: Why Closing Strait Of Hormuz Could Backfire On Iran
content: The war between Israel and Iran has raised concerns that Iran could retaliate by trying to close the Strait of Hormuz, the world's most important oil chokepoint in terms of the large volumes of crude that pass through it every day.

title: 4 Decades Later, 2nd Indian Heads To Space Today On Axiom Mission
content: Axiom Mission 4 to the International Space Station -- carrying India's Shubhanshu Shukla and three other astronauts -- will lift off at 12.01 pm on Wednesday. The launch was earlier scheduled for June 22, but had to be deferred.

title: What Trump Said After Report Claims Strikes Didn't Destroy Iran Nuke Sites: 10 Points
content: Israel and Iran agreed to a ceasefire on Tuesday, ending 12 days of tit-for-tat strikes. However, a new intel report claimed US strikes on the Islamic republic did not destroy Tehran's nuclear program, as claimed by US President Donald Trump.

title: Bengaluru Man Alleges Attackers Forced His Friend To Chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
content: A man and his friend were allegedly assaulted by a group of unidentified men in Bengaluru, the police have said. The incident occurred around 4:30 pm-5:30 pm in the Sampigehalli police station limits last Sunday.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: White House Dismisses Intel Reports Saying US Did Not Destroy Iran's Nuke Sites
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: "It Was My Great Honour To Destroy All Iranian Nuclear Facilities.": Trump
content: Trump on Tuesday expressed his satisfaction in stopping "THE WAR" between Iran and Israel, asserting that it was his "great honour" to destroy all of Iran's nuclear facilities and capabilities before brokering a ceasefire between the two nations.

title: Hearing In Sheikh Hasina's Crimes Against Humanity Case On July 1
content: The indictment hearing in the crimes against humanity case against Bangladesh's deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been set for July 1, the country's crimes tribunal announced on Tuesday.

title: US Strikes On Iran Did Not Destroy Nuclear Sites: Report
content: An early US intelligence assessment indicated that the US military strikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities last week did not destroy the core components of Tehran's nuclear program and likely only set it back by months, CNN reported on Tuesday.

title: Operation Sindhu: 282 More Indians Evacuated From Iran; Total Reaches 2,858
content: Another special flight carrying 282 Indian nationals stranded in conflict-hit Iran landed safely in New Delhi on Wednesday, taking the total number of people evacuated under Operation Sindhu to 2,858.

title: Trump Tells Congress Iran Had Nuclear Weapons Program, Contradicting US Spy Agencies
content: U.S. President Donald Trump told Congress this week that the Iranian sites bombed by the U.S. housed a "nuclear weapons development program," even though U.S. spy agencies have said no such program existed.

title: Earthquake Of 4.2 Magnitude Hits Andaman Sea
content: An earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Richter scale struck the Andaman Sea in the early hours on Wednesday, according to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS).

title: Netanyahu Vows To Thwart "Any Attempt" By Iran To Rebuild Nuclear Programme
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared a "historic victory" on Tuesday after agreeing a ceasefire with Iran and insisted that his country's arch-foe would never achieve a nuclear weapon.

title: Netanyahu Hails Historic Win, Commits To Campaign Against Iran Axis, Hamas
content: PM Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel had achieved a historic victory that would stand for generations, but it must complete its campaign against Iran's axis, defeat Hamas and bring about the return of all the hostages in Gaza.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raj Kushwaha Admitted To Relationship: Cops On Honeymoon Murder

title: Elections To Chandigarh Mayoral Polls Can Now Be Held By Show Of Hands
content: Election to the posts of mayor, senior deputy mayor, and deputy mayor of the Chandigarh Municipal Corporation can now be held by a show of hands instead of a secret ballot.

title: VMC council meet sees heated discussion on drinking water needs, drainage works in Vijayawada

title: Devise ways to increase revenue of gram panchayats for a more effective Panchayati Raj system: Amit Shah
content: In a meeting attended by the CMs of four BJP-ruled States, the Union Home Minister said all States should ensure the eradication of child malnutrition, bring the school dropout ratio down to zero, and strengthen the cooperative sector

title: Not 'obliterated'? US intel says Iran can restore nuke sites 'within months'; contradicts Trump
content: Conflicting reports emerge regarding the success of US air strikes on Iran's nuclear program. While President Trump claimed complete obliteration, intelligence assessments suggest key facilities were damaged but not destroyed, potentially recoverable within months. Despite White House denials and a fragile ceasefire, experts warn Iran retains the capacity to reconstitute its nuclear program, raising concerns about long-term implications.

title: Axiom-4 mission with Shubhanshu Shukla set to launch today; check time
content: Axiom Mission 4, featuring ISRO astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the International Space Station on Wednesday, with SpaceX reporting favorable weather conditions. The mission, utilizing a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket, will lift off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center.

title: ‚ÄòPushed her off the roof‚Äô: Delhi girl pushed to death by stalker in burqa
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi, 19-year-old Neha was allegedly pushed to her death from a rooftop by Taufiq, a man she once considered a brother. The father, Surender Kumar, witnessed the horrific event after Taufiq, disguised in a burqa, attacked Neha.

title: 'Fake news': Trump goes ballistic after US intel contradicts his Iran claims
content: Donald Trump refuted a CNN report alleging the US strikes on Iran's nuclear program were ineffective, labeling it "FAKE NEWS" and asserting the sites were "completely destroyed." White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt also dismissed the report as "flat-out wrong," while Special Envoy Steve Witkoff condemned the intelligence leak as "treasonous," insisting on the site's obliteration.

title: 'We've no money': Karnataka HM's quip stirs row; later clarifies
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara's lighthearted comments about a shortage of funds in the state government have sparked a political controversy after a video of his speech went viral. Parameshwara clarified that his remarks were made in jest and were misconstrued, emphasizing the state's fiscal strength and commitment to welfare schemes.

title: Accenture sees highest-ever quarterly drop in headcount, as numbers fall by ...; America's contributed largest to total revenue
content: Accenture's Q3 FY25 saw an 8% revenue increase, reaching $7.7 billion, fueled by AI service demand. Despite a gross margin dip and workforce reduction, the company raised its revenue growth forecast. Generative AI bookings surged, contributing significantly to overall revenue, with the Americas leading regional performance. The company projects strong Q4 revenues, emphasizing its role as a reinvention partner.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for June 25, 2025 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares' Mehul Kothari suggests buying Ramco Systems, Minda Corp, and JSW Infrastructure. Ramco Systems shows reversal potential from support at ‚Çπ390, targeting ‚Çπ480. Minda Corp is retesting a breakout zone near ‚Çπ510, aiming for ‚Çπ550. JSW Infra is poised for a breakout above ‚Çπ314, potentially reaching ‚Çπ340, after forming a double bottom pattern.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change privacy setting on FB, Instagram; What embassy said
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Chhattisgarh horror: Disabled killed, then encased in cement & put in suitcase; married couple held
content: A disabled man's body, found encased in cement within a suitcase and steel trunk in Raipur, led police to a married couple at Delhi airport. Lawyer Ankit Upadhyay and his wife are suspected of murdering Kishore Paikra over a land brokerage dispute.

title: For 2 decades, suicide among top 2 causes of death of young Indians
content: A recent analysis of cause of death reports reveals a concerning trend in India, where suicide remains a leading cause of death among young individuals aged 15-29. Between 2020 and 2022, suicides accounted for 17.1% of deaths in this age group, ranking second only to road accidents.

title: Once invincible, now vulnerable: Is this India‚Äôs worst Test era?
content: England's dominant victory at Headingley has put India's Test cricket dominance under scrutiny. Despite centuries from Gill, Rahul, and Pant, India's sole win in nine Tests contrasts sharply with the consistent success of England, Australia, and South Africa. Root's unbeaten innings secured England's record chase, exposing India's fielding lapses and tail-end collapses.

title: AI heat at Amazon: CEO says jobs may go; staff respond with ‚ÄòNothing more motivating on a Tuesday‚Äô
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: 'I Race Athletes, Not YouTubers': Tyreek Hill Slams IShowSpeed as Olympic Clash Collapses
content: A highly anticipated race between Tyreek Hill and Noah Lyles was canceled, leading to online drama. Hill criticized IShowSpeed for allegedly turning the event into a spectacle after Lyles withdrew. Speed's fans defended him, highlighting his role in generating buzz, sparking a debate about the intersection of sports and influencer culture.

title: Root on cusp of smashing Tendulkar‚Äôs record as Eng stun Ind at Headingley
content: Joe Root's composed, unbeaten half-century guided England to a historic victory in the Headingley Test, frustrating India's hopes. Root's innings, a blend of poise and precision, complemented the earlier explosive start by Duckett and Crawley. This win highlights England's 'Bazball' approach, showcasing both boldness and control.

title: Diabetes: Can calf raises help lower sugar levels? Man shares how this simple exercise helped him
content: With diabetes on the rise, a viral video features Rahul Lalchandani sharing how he lowered his HbA1c levels through lifestyle changes. A key tip from his nutritionist involves performing seated calf raises for 10 minutes after meals. Studies suggest this exercise activates the soleus muscle, potentially lowering sugar levels by up to 52% by improving insulin response and glucose uptake.

title: ‚ÄòKuberaa‚Äô box office Day 6: Dhanush-Nagarjuna starrer inches toward ‚Çπ61 crore; continues strong weekday run
content: Dhanush and Nagarjuna's 'Kuberaa' is maintaining a steady performance at the box office, accumulating Rs 60.71 crore in India after six days. The film had a strong opening weekend, driven by positive word-of-mouth and the actors' fanbases, though weekday collections have seen a typical drop. With a stellar cast and no major releases on the horizon, 'Kuberaa' is expected to continue its run in cinemas.

title: Pant creates a rare record no batter wants as India choke at Headingley
content: Rishabh Pant's exceptional batting prowess was on full display at Headingley, where he scored centuries in both innings, reaffirming his reputation as India's most fearless Test batter abroad. Despite his heroics and a crucial partnership with KL Rahul, India suffered a loss, highlighting the need for greater team support to convert Pant's individual brilliance into victories.

title: 'It‚Äôs not a fair matchup': Patrick Mahomes‚Äô mother shares views on trans athletes, faces backlash
content: Randi Mahomes, mother of Patrick Mahomes, shares her views on transgender athletes. She speaks about fairness in women's sports. She emphasizes biological differences. She suggests separate categories for competition. Her comments reignite a national debate. This debate concerns fairness and inclusion. It also concerns athletic integrity. Her stance arrives amid ongoing discussions. Several states are tightening rules on trans participation.

title: 'Pushed into deep sea, but he‚Äôll swim'- Gambhir on Gill‚Äôs first Test as captain
content: Gautam Gambhir has urged critics to give Shubman Gill time to prove himself as India's Test captain, despite a recent defeat against England. Gambhir praised Gill's leadership as "phenomenal," highlighting his first-innings century under pressure. He acknowledged the challenges of captaining in tough conditions and expressed confidence in Gill's potential for success.

title: Novo Nordisk‚Äôs Wegovy debuts in India: How it works, who it‚Äôs for, and how much it costs
content: Novo Nordisk has launched Wegovy in India, a weight-loss drug challenging Eli Lilly's Mounjaro. Available by June 2025, Wegovy is a once-weekly injectable using a user-friendly FlexTouch pen. Targeting India's large obese population, Novo Nordisk aims to capture a significant share of the ‚Çπ576 crore anti-obesity market.

title: Ostrava Golden Spike: Neeraj Chopra clinches top prize with 85.29m throw, only athlete to breach 85m-mark at event
content: Neeraj Chopra clinched the men's javelin title at the Ostrava Golden Spike meet in the Czech Republic with a throw of 85.29 metres. This victory follows his recent triumph at the Paris Diamond League. Douw Smit of South Africa secured second place, while Anderson Peters from Grenada finished third in the competition directed by Jan Zelezny.

title: Rajasthan horror: French tourist raped in Udaipur apartment; suspect on the run
content: In Udaipur, a 30-year-old French tourist reported being raped by a man she met at a caf√©. Puspraj, alias Siddharth, offered to show her around, but allegedly assaulted her at his rented apartment in Sukher on Sunday night. The survivor filed a police complaint after undergoing medical tests.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô box office collection day 5: Aamir Khan starrer maintains steady pace
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D‚ÄôSouza's ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô has garnered significant audience attention, earning over Rs. 70 crore within five days of its release. Despite a dip on Monday, the film maintained its momentum on Tuesday, reaching a total collection of Rs. 75.15 crore. The movie, directed by R.S. Prasanna, is considered a spiritual sequel to ‚ÄòTaare Zameen Par‚Äô.

title: Kolkata professor returns from Iran: After 10 days wait and $20 in pocket
content: Falguni Dey, a geography professor from Kolkata, safely returned home after being stranded in war-torn Iran for ten days. Evacuated by the Indian embassy on a Mahan Air flight from Mashhad, he recounted his harrowing experience of evading missile strikes and failed attempts to cross borders with limited resources.

title: Ceasefire imposed, ceasefire violated but 'war stopped'? : How Iran and Israel disappointed Trump- key developments
content: Donald Trump declared a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, but it quickly collapsed with both nations trading accusations and missile strikes. Trump expressed his frustration, particularly with Israel's actions. Israel retaliated to alleged Iranian violations, including a strike that killed a nuclear scientist, while Iran vowed a strong response to further aggression.

title: UK man arrested over Disneyland ‚Äòwedding‚Äô with 9-year-old Ukrainian girl
content: A British man, a convicted sex offender wanted in the UK, has been charged in France for staging a fake wedding at Disneyland Paris. He allegedly hired actors, including one to play the bride's father, for the ceremony where a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl was the 'bride'. The event, costing an estimated $150,000, was halted by Disneyland staff.

title: Kevin Durant has deeper reason why he won‚Äôt return to Warriors
content: Kevin Durant's move to the Houston Rockets is imminent, disappointing Golden State Warriors fans who hoped for his return. Durant's past issues with coach Steve Kerr's offensive strategies and lingering tensions from his time with Draymond Green contributed to his decision to avoid returning to Golden State. Durant is looking forward to a fresh start with the Rockets.

title: 'Friendly plane wave': Israel defies Trump's ceasefire plan; launches more missiles at Iran
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, tensions flared again between Israel and Iran, prompting US President Donald Trump to intervene. Trump assured that Israel would cease its attacks, claiming they would simply do a "Plane Wave" to Iran. Despite the ceasefire announcement, both sides accused each other of violations, with Israel citing Iranian missile fire.

title: 12 days of fire: Iran ends 'adventurism war' imposed by Israel; Tel Aviv shifts back focus to Gaza
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian declared the end of the 12-day war with Israel, attributing it to the nation's heroic resistance. In response, Israeli chief of staff Eyal Zamir announced a shift in focus back to dismantling Hamas in Gaza and securing the release of hostages. Israel is lifting restrictions on public gatherings, workplaces, and education, signaling a return to normalcy, though guidelines remain effective until Thursday evening.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit ‚ÄúWhat Jhumka?‚Äù while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: 'Not leaping to join BJP': Tharoor on his Op Sindoor article
content: Shashi Tharoor clarified that his praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts during Operation Sindoor doesn't signal a shift to the BJP. He emphasised national unity and India's interests as his motivations, highlighting the importance of cross-party solidarity in foreign policy. Tharoor's article sparked speculation amid Congress's criticism of the government's foreign policy.

title: 'She‚Äôs heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: MCWS 2025: What it means for LSU, favorite moments, 2026 predictions
content: the 2025 MCWS broke away from last year's SEC/ACC takeover . the tournament was the 75th anniversary of the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska . analysts share their favorite moments from the tournament and offer predictions for 2026 .

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: Jon Jones operated on his terms, even in announcing his retirement
content: david frum: the retirement news of arguably the greatest mixed martial artist of all time was underwhelming . he says he was let down by the man he recently called the best pound-for-pound fighter in the world . his retirement squashed a highly anticipated heavyweight title unification fight between Jones and iraq . frum says it's not the end of Jones' complicated career .

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal so far
content: the offseason is here, and trades are already being agreed to across the league . the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, reports
content: noggets president Josh Kroenke explains a scenario in which the team could end up trading Nikola Jokic under the second apron . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster now that Jayson Tatum will miss a good portion next season .

title: First-team reps? Big plays? A sneak peek at how the 2025 NFL draft first-rounders look
content: rookies across the league have had their chance to make their first impressions . there were 32 first-round picks from the 2025 draft . a group of rookie pass catchers came to the building at 5 a.m. .
